#summary Instructions on how to use connect TongueTied to a PostgreSQL database.

= Introduction =

!TongueTied requires a few steps to be performed in order to connect to a PostgreSQL database.


= Details =

  # Extract the web archive file, if using !TongueTied with an embedded server start the server by running the batch file `startServer.bat` or `startServer.sh`.
  # After the server has started, stop the server. 
  # Open the file `<TONGUETIED_HOME>/tonguetied/webapp/WEB-INF/jdbc.properties`
  # Set your PostgreSQL Connection to something like the following:
{{{
jdbc.driverClassName=org.postgresql.Driver
jdbc.port=5432
jdbc.name=tonguetied
jdbc.url=jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/tonguetied
jdbc.username=postgres
jdbc.password=password
hibernate.dialect=org.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect
}}}
  # Restart the server.
